head.supplied: Botan. Gard. 1.10/66 ¶ ¶ Received from Dr F. Mueller one pound seven shillings for eighteen days labor, at 1/6 pr day assisting carpenter in planing wood specimens for the Exhibition ¶ L. Petersen ¶ ...

div.p: P67/474, unit 381, VPRS 3991 inward registered correspondence, VA 475 Chief Secretary's Office, Public Record Office, Victoria.
MS is annotated 'No 44' of 74 receipts covering materials supplied for the Intercolonial Exhibition of Australasia, Melbourne, 1866-7, for which M was one of the Commissioners. Botan. Gard. 1.10/66

Received from Dr F. Mueller one pound seven shillings for eighteen days labor, at 1/6 pr day assisting carpenter in planing wood specimens for the Exhibition
The low rate of pay indicates that Petersen was a junior, probably a son of the carpenter Henry Petersen who was preparing timber specimens for the Exhibition; see H. Petersen to M, 1 October 1866 (in this edition as 66-10-01a), and M's reference, some years later, to Henry Petersen's having children who were by then adults (M to J. McCulloch, 3 October 1870).

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;
